Comments_List: I learnt about key events in middle east history as well as key players. I was especially grateful for Amb. Crockers lessons and pet peeves along the way. By the way he has interacted with these characters throughout his career, you can really get to see what it is like to do diplomacy in a challenging part of the world.
I learned a detailed history of the Middle East and how many of today's most pressing issues have significant historical dimensions.

I dont think this class should be repeated in this form at all. It could be kind of a capstone, but without a syllabus and consistent readings, it would simply be a waste of precious resources to offer this class again in its form.

Strengths -- I enjoyed the focus on historical issues and how Amb. Crocker weaves in current events. He's an expert and deeply knowledgable. 

Weakness -- the course is very unstructured -- which I don't mind -- but I do think you can achieve more in a course if you have a roadmap of where you're heading.
No I would not. Get to know Amb Crocker if you can outside of a class context.

Yes. I would recommend this course to anyone who wants a solid groundwork for understanding the Middle East. From the Muslim brotherhood, to the Palestinian liberation movement, to the Anglo-Afghan Wars, this course is fundamental to understanding the crises in the Middle East.
